type.name: section
type.title: Production of certificate of immunisation before admission to  school or day-care centre.
type.context: PUBLIC HEALTH (SCHOOL CHILDREN)   IMMUNISATION ACT under Production of certificate of immunisation before admission to  school or day-care centre. 3. (1) Subject to subsection (2), no person shall be admitted to a school or day-care centre unless that person produces a certificate of immunisation to the Head Teacher or Principal of the school, or the Supervisor, as the case may be. mainly for  the purpose of providingeducation suitable LAWS OF GUYANA Public Health (School Children)  Immunisation Cap. 35:02 5  L.R.O. 1/2012 admission to school or day- care centre. (2) If a person produces a certificate signed by a Health Officer certifying that immunisation against any communicable disease is not advisable on medical grounds, a certificate of immunisation is not required for the purpose of subsection (1).  (3) Where the production of a certificate of immunisation is not required with respect to a person by virtue of subsection (2), the Head Teacher or Principal of the school, or the Supervisor, as the case may be, shall enter the name of that person in a register kept for the purpose.

type.name: section
type.title: Powers of the Minister.
type.context: PUBLIC HEALTH (SCHOOL CHILDREN)   IMMUNISATION ACT under Powers of the Minister. 4. If  any  communicable  disease  becomes  epidemic,  or  if  an epidemic of any such disease is threatened the Minister may, notwithstanding section 3(2), by notice  (a)   suspend persons whose names are recorded in the register in pursuance of section 3(3) from attending any school or day-care centre; and  (b)     direct that admission to any school or day-care centre shall be refused to every person who does not comply with the provisions of section 3(1).

type.name: section
type.title: Penalties.
type.context: PUBLIC HEALTH (SCHOOL CHILDREN)   IMMUNISATION ACT under Penalties. 5. Every Head Teacher or  Principal  of  a  school,  and  every Supervisor, who contravenes the provisions of  (a)     section  3(1)  or  section  4  is  liable  on  summary conviction  to  a  fine  of  nineteen  thousand  five hundred dollars;  (b)  section 3(3) is liable on summary conviction to a fine of six thousand  five hundred dollars.
